name: Harbin Hot Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been a regular visitor to Harbin for more than a decade. I just discovered this page and read through a bunch of reviews and felt drawn to add my own experience to provide some deeper perspective.
reviews.title: A very special place.

reviews.text: What I want to say, and what I think is more important than anyone else, is that you need to know what Harbin is, and what Harbin isn't, and you choose choose to come or not come based on how it fits with your needs.
reviews.title: Good for workshops, or just to unwind

reviews.text: Harbin is a very natural and relaxing place. If you want to be in nature, and chill, it can't be beat.
reviews.title: Go in knowing what to expect, and you'll enjoy it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for "service" in the modern American mass-tourism sense, you won't find it here.
reviews.title: A unique experience!

reviews.text: The waters are fantastic and it's one of the only places that has a hot pool, a cold pool, a warm pool, and a swimming pool. They use minimum chemicals, so the water is as pure as possible.
reviews.title: Go get Harbinized!

reviews.text: Loved the chill vibe at Harbin. I took my then 2yo son and it was great. There were other families there - pretty busy. We picked grapes from the pergola over one pool. Next time we will stay and do yoga :)
reviews.title: Good end to winery drive

reviews.text: Horror movie material. Weird vibes, terrible service and accommodations. It was impossible to relax despite how pretty the weather and location.
reviews.title: Claw marks on the sealed shut windows. Go somewhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The windows in the dome rooms don't open and there are claw marks from other guests who tried to open the latches which were supposed to open the sealed windows. An afterthought air conditioner resembling R2D2 vibrated the room and made me feel like I was on a starship. We changed rooms with a hastle, then came breakfast.
reviews.title: Self Enlightened - Self Deceived

reviews.text: Food is really great. Expensive, but great.
reviews.title: Horrible stinky hotel rooms

reviews.text: Soaking was very weird. I go to Orr a lot and this place is way different. People are somehow in your face the whole time. Weird sex ecstasy stuff constantly in the tubs. Felt awkward, but it is a silent pool so no distraction possible as creepie make out sessions were going on inches away. All we could do to stop nervously laughing was cling to eachothers hands. I went no where without feeling like I needed my partners assistance for either emotional support or because the place has totally confusing signs. Never have any idea where things are - the maps were made by a moron. Very few signs.
reviews.title: Great springs, major hippie vibe

reviews.text: I recently visited the springs with a friend that frequents them often. He talked about them for several days so the experience was not as great as the anticipation. We went at night and stayed for several hours trying each of the springs several times. The whole place had a weird, not quite comfortable vibe. The patrons seemed diverse in everything but race, almost every single person was white, and that added some awkwardness; rather than enjoy community most folks were extremely standoffish.
reviews.title: An Interesting But Awkward Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps it was just an off night. The place has a lot of potential and I'm willing to try it again but part of me has a feeling that this isn't quite my scene.
reviews.title: Leave your worries behind and breathe in serenity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The road from Calistoga takes about 40 minutes across the hills, narrow at times and steep. Temperature about 10 degrees cooler than in the valley. It gets remote up there, trees, meadows, cows, a few houses and the milky way. Pay at the entrance gate: membership plus day use (or 6 hour use 20$ on weekdays, we opted for 24 hours = 30$ weekdays and stayed in Calistoga).There are complimentary Yoga sessions typically three times daily. Walk up to the pool area: which consists of a changing room and toilets, showers (rinse off before entering the pools, soap dispenser included). Basically three "hot" pools: the largest is a quiet zone, with the lowest temperature, next to it in a small house is the hottest pool (110F), nearby upstairs a cold plunge.
reviews.title: Great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The heart-shaped pool is medium hot, and subdued conversation is OK here. Swimming pool was mostly empty due to lower temperature, probably more popular in the summer.
reviews.title: Fantastic Potential

reviews.text: Sauna and steam room are also nearby. There are a few eating options, as well as a library. The majority of soakers were naked, everyone was very quiet which adds to the overall atmosphere. There seemed to have been primarily couples, a few single ladies and men. May have been due to the holiday season, all overnight options (except camping) were booked out. Parking is at a lower level than the pools (which are highest). Food options and library are half way up the hill. Definitely nice getaway, worthy of a destination.
reviews.title: Many Visits, Many More Planned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live in Boise Idaho and traveled 4 times in 2012 to Harbin Hot Springs in California. We went to attend Tantric massage classes, which were absolutely fantastic, and loved our time at Harbin.
reviews.title: One Great Place!!!
Great experience!!!
reviews.text: To us this place is more of a spiritual retreat with time and space to unwind, meditate, and relax. We have stayed in the Domes, which were suprisingly quite (we were in the large dome room directly over the Bathrooms) and having two pools just outside the door was pretty hard to beat. We also have stayed in the Medow Building, which attendies of the tantric workshops can do, and found it to be a pretty nice place to bunk up. Also, we have camped in the meadow, under a big Oak tree which was very nice, however the Bathrooms and the Hot Pools are not real handy. But, waking up with wild turkeys and deer right outside our tent was pretty cool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are great and cuddling up in the meditation pool together was great. Really a super place to connect with your partner on a subconcious level. The conversation pools are nice as well and we have meet people in them from all over the world.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: Harbin is clothing optional (Except on the main roadways) which in my experience means that mostly everyone in the pool area is nude (In fact, if your nude in the pools nobody will notice you, but if you wear a swim suit people will look at you and wonder what's wrong) and outside of the pool area everbody generally weres clothes the rest of the time.
reviews.title: Neo-Hippie Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The general store is very quaint but expensive, The retaurant is very good, and the Coffee shop is average.
reviews.title: Top ten complaints about Harbin Hot Springs

description: Historic, non-profit retreat and workshop center hidden in the hills north of Calistoga and the Napa Valley. Rated one of the best places in the USA for massage. Thousand of acres of private land to explore. Meditative, relaxed environment.
